node.title: Christchurch shooter flags appeal, claiming guilty pleas were made under duress
node.alt: A sign at a memorial on Dean's Avenue in Christchurch reads "This is your home and you should have been safe here".
node.description: The Australian man convicted of killing 51 people in the attacks onÂ two Christchurch mosques is claiming he experienced inhumane and degrading treatment while in custody.
node.content:
["The Australian man convicted of killing 51 people in the Christchurch mosque attack is claiming he pleaded guilty while under duress, local media outlets are reporting.", "Brenton Tarrant recently engaged human rights lawyer Tony Ellis ahead of an upcoming coroner's inquiry into the March 2019 mass shooting.", "In a\u00a0memorandum sent to New Zealand's chief coroner, Mr Ellis said\u00a0Tarrant believed\u00a0he had\u00a0received \"inhumane and degrading\" treatment while in custody and awaiting trial, according to details published by media outlets Radio New Zealand and Stuff.\u00a0\u00a0", "The reports noted Mr Ellis indicated he had\u00a0advised his client to appeal\u00a0his sentence and conviction, and argued mistreatment in custody would amount\u00a0to a breach of New Zealand's Bill of Rights.", "New Zealand authorities are yet to respond to the claims.", "
Possibility for appeal
", "On March 15, 2019, Tarrant attacked Friday worshippers at Christchurch's Al Noor mosque, before moving on to the Linwood prayer centre.", "His victims were all Muslim and included children, women and the elderly.", "Tarrant originally pleaded not guilty to the 51 counts of\u00a0murder, 40 counts of attempted murder and one count of committing a terrorist act, but changed his pleas on all counts to guilty at a hearing in March 2020.", "New Zealand does not have the death penalty and in sentencing in August last year, Judge Cameron Mander said he was imposing the harshest possible term for Tarrant's \"inhuman\" actions.", "\"Your crimes are so wicked, that even if you are detained until you die it will not exhaust the requirements of punishment and denunciation,\" Mander said at the time.", "Tarrant was sentenced to life without parole.", "", "
The attacker received the harshest sentence possible after pleading guilty to killing 51 people.\u00a0(ABC News: Brendan Esposito)
", "Auckland University of Technology law professor Dr Kris Gledhill said New Zealand's Criminal Procedure Act 2011 \"requires that an appeal against conviction be started within 20 days of the sentence\".", "\"But\u00a0the appeal court \u2014 which in this case would be the New Zealand Court of Appeal \u2014 is able to extend the time limit, and so there will have to be an application to extend the time limit.", "\"That is the usual way of allowing consideration of appeals when there has been an allegation that legal representation was inadequate or there were some other problems about which there is a need to call evidence.\"\u00a0", "Dr Gledhill said that process, if it was to eventuate could take \"quite some time\".\u00a0", "
Hearing next month
", "When contacted by the ABC, the New Zealand's Coroner's Court confirmed to it had received the correspondence from Mr Ellis, but would not release the details of the memorandum.", "The court is due to hold a hearing into the scope of the inquest next month.", "When the inquiry was announced, the March 15 Whanau Trust said it hoped for answers.\u00a0", "\"This will enable all of us to understand the events of and surrounding the terrorist attack to be properly examined and answer the unanswered questions we have,\" their statement said.\u00a0", "New Zealand held a royal commission into the attack, which\u00a0recommended new legislation to criminalise planning or preparing a terrorist attack, and the strengthening of laws around hate speech.", "ABC/wires"]
